meanings.definition: A type of electric light used in photography.
meanings.sent1: The photographer set up the photofloods to brighten the studio.
meanings.sent2: The photofloods provided ample light for the photo shoot.
meanings.sent3: Why did the photofloods refuse to shine during the photoshoot? They must be camera shy!
meanings.sent4: The photofloods flooded the room with light, turning it into a well-lit studio.
meanings.sent5: The bright beams from the photofloods made the models look stunning in the photos.

meanings.sent1: The photographer decided to photofloods the set for a better picture.
meanings.sent2: She carefully photofloods the subject to capture every detail.
meanings.sent3: When in doubt, just photofloods the scene and see the magic happen!
meanings.sent4: His smile photofloods the room with happiness, just like the bright lights.
meanings.sent5: The photographer skillfully photofloods the stage, creating a captivating image.

meanings.definition: The act of using photofloods for lighting in photography.
meanings.sent1: Her expertise in photofloods made her the go-to person for lighting setups.
meanings.sent2: The photofloods technique revolutionized the way photos were taken.
meanings.sent3: The photofloods dance of light and shadows mesmerized everyone on set.
meanings.sent4: Photofloods became an essential part of his photography arsenal, enhancing every shot.
meanings.sent5: The art of photofloods transformed ordinary images into extraordinary works of art.
